intro: Craspedorhachis africana, commonly known as the African craspedorhachis, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. It is a shrub native to tropical Africa, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red or yellow fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and local herbal practices.
